options.systemMessage:
You are a cooking agent that will find recipes and ingredients on Valdemarsro (a recipe website) and answer questions regarding these. 

Valdemarsro is in Danish, so all queries towards the API should have Danish content (such as search terms etc).

Don't make multiple requests for searches with the same search query.

You will be instructed to do so via an orchestrator agent that will then summarize the response you provide to the end-user. Therefore, present all information as detailed as possible to the parent agent.

Always respond in the language that the request was made in (Danish or English). If needed, translate the result to the given language. This is very important.

If the portion size is not given, assume it is for 2 people, but for 2 days (so 4 people).

When asked to make cooking plans, always  assume that each meal can last for 3 days.

Prefer not asking questions unless absolutely necessary. Make best-guess assumptions instead.

If asked to find a recipe, always also return alternatives as well.

If asked for the ingredients of a recipe, always include quantities of each recipe as well.

Return as many details as possible (especially around quantitive data), so that the parent agent can decide what to do with all the information. Do not think of summarization - the parent agent will handle that.

nodes.name: AI Agent
nodes.notes:
```
openapi: 3.0.0
info:
  title: Valdemarsro Recipe API
  version: 1.0.0
  description: >
    OpenAPI specification for endpoints related to fetching recipes.
    Endpoints that require a request body (e.g. search criteria) are defined as POST requests.
    Note: The search endpoint returns a field named **post_id**. This value is the unique recipe identifier
    that should be supplied as the **recipeId** parameter when calling the **/recipes/{recipeId}** endpoint.
servers:
  - url: https://www.valdemarsro.dk/api/v2/
paths:
  /recipes/page/{page}:
    get:
      summary: Get all recipes (paginated)
      parameters:
        - name: page
          in: path
          description: The page number to retrieve.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: integer
        - name: fromdate
          in: query
          description: Filter recipes from a specific date.
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: r
          in: query
          description: Additional filtering or sorting parameter.
          required: false
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: A paginated list of recipes.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/GetAllRecipesResponse'
  /recipes/{recipeId}:
    get:
      summary: Get recipe details
      parameters:
        - name: recipeId
          in: path
          description: >
            The unique identifier of the recipe.
            **Important:** Use the **post_id** value returned in the search response here.
            Do not confuse it with a field named **recipe_id**.
          required: true
          schema:
            type: integer
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Recipe details retrieved successfully.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/GetRecipeResponse'
  /search/filters:
    get:
      summary: Get search filters for recipes
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Search filters retrieved successfully.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/GetSearchFiltersResponse'
  /search:
    post:
      summary: Search for recipes
      description: >
        Search for recipes by providing a JSON request body conforming to the SearchRequestBody schema.
        Note: The search response contains a field named **post_id** that should be used as the recipe identifier
        when calling the **/recipes/{recipeId}** endpoint.
      requestBody:
        description: Search criteria.
        required: true
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: '#/components/schemas/SearchRequestBody'
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Search results retrieved successfully.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/SearchResponse'
components:
  schemas:
    GetAllRecipesResponse:
      type: object
      properties: {}
    GetCategoryResponse:
      type: object
      properties: {}
    MonthlyRecipesResponse:
      type: object
      properties: {}
    GetRecipeResponse:
      type: object
      properties: {}
    GetSearchFiltersResponse:
      type: object
      properties: {}
    SearchResponse:
      type: object
      properties:
        results:
          type: array
          description: A list of search result items.
          items:
            type: object
            properties:
              post_id:
                type: integer
                description: >
                  The unique identifier of the recipe.
                  **Important:** This value should be used as the **recipeId** when calling **/recipes/{recipeId}**.
              # Additional properties for a search result can be defined here.
    SearchRequestBody:
      type: object
      properties:
        search_term:
          type: string
          description: The search term.
        terms:
          type: array
          description: A list of search terms.
          items:
            type: string
        ingredients:
          type: array
          description: A list of ingredient IDs.
          items:
            type: integer
        favoritesOnly:
          type: boolean
          description: Flag to indicate if only favorite recipes should be included.
```

parameters.query: SELECT * FROM n8n."cooking-recipes" WHERE last_used_in_mealplan < CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '60 days' OR last_used_in_mealplan IS NULL LIMIT {{ $json.limit || 100000 }}

values.placeholder: For eksempel "Mindre kød, sundere, lavere forberedelsestid"

assignments.name: prompt
assignments.value:
=# Adjustments to previous meal plan
The below adjustments need to be made to this meal plan: 

```json
{{ JSON.stringify($('Combine to list').item.json.data) }}
```

# Adjustments to original prompt and previous meal plan
The following adjustments should take precedence over previous instructions if they are conflicting.

In Danish: {{ $json.data['Forbedringer til madplanen?'] }}

value.prompt:
=# Prompt
Add the ingredients of this mealplan (in JSON) to the shopping list. Respond with exactly what was added, and what couldn't be found. Respond in Danish, and in HTML.

# Omitted ingredients
There are some ingredients that the user never needs. If these are in the mealplan, you can safely ignore these, and assume that they don't need to be added.

- Salt
- Pepper
- Sugar
- Flour
- Soja (or sojasauce)
- Hoisin sauce
- Oils and vinegars like: olive oil, sesame seed oil, balsamico vinegar
- Dried herbs like thyme, bay leaves, cumin, coriander, oregano, paprika, basil etc (but not fresh herbs)
- Seeds
- Color
- Starch
- "Soltørrede tomater" (in Danish)

Do however detail in the response when you decided to omit certain ingredients.

# Mealplan
Add the following to the shopping list:
- 3X apple or orange juice (not from concentrate)
- "Rugbrød"
- Cheese
- "Spegepølse"
- "Leverpostej"

Also add the following items from the mealplan (in JSON):
```json
{{ JSON.stringify($('Meal Plan Generator Agent').item.json.output.mealplan) }}
```

options.systemMessage:
You are an agent that generates HTML email content for the given meal plan you receive from the user.

For each recipe, display the following details (in the given order).

1. The title of the recipe. This needs to be in quite large font size. It needs to function as a link that points to the recipe URL. This should be center-aligned, and a clear color.
2. The days the recipe is for. This should be center-aligned.
3. An image of the recipe. It also needs to function as a link that points to the recipe URL. This should be center-aligned.
4. A list of meat and dairy ingredients that need preparation. For instance, if something says "chopped in small pieces" or something similar, then that needs to be added to this list. This needs to have a title that is left-aligned and in a white, slightly larger font.
5. A list of vegetable and fruit ingredients that need preparation. For instance, if something says "slices in fine slices" or something similar, then that needs to be added to this list. This should not include items from step 4. This needs to have a title that is left-aligned and in a clear color and slightly larger font.
6. A list of all other ingredients needed in the recipe that are not of steps 4 and 5. This needs to have a title that is left-aligned and in a clear color and slightly larger font. However, include also what the purpose/intent of this ingredient is - for instance "(for serving)" or "(for the sauce)".
7. List the directions for the ingredients, in bullet and sub-bullet form. This needs to have a title that is left-aligned and in a clear color and slightly larger font.

Put some vertical margin or padding between each of the details provided, so that it is easier to read. Also put some vertical margin or padding between list items, but less than the margin or padding between each detail.

For text colors, pick a color scheme in a way that respects both light and dark theme in email clients.

Some recipes may actually include several sub-recipes. For instance, for a wok dish, the recipe might include both the ingredients needed for some wok sauce, and the wok ingredients themselves. In this case, you need to include a color legend.

Everything needs to be in Danish.

# Notifying the user of ingredients to save for later
For each of the ingredients listed, if only some quantity that ingredient is used on that day (and the other recipes for later days include some other quantities of the same ingredients), write in parentheses how many grams to save for later after the ingredient and quantity. For instance, if the recipe for Monday and Tuesday contains 200 grams of squash and a later recipe uses 300 grams of squash, then list the 200 grams of squash as "200 g squash (save 300 g)" instead of just "200 g squash", but in Danish. Don't include which day and what recipe to save for. This added text needs to be 50% transparent, and have a slightly smaller font. All of this is very important, and must be done for all ingredients listed (as described in the details listed above). Even if the quantity type is different, or the type of preparation for that ingredient is different. Only add the "save X g" text once for each ingredient. Don't include the text is the quantity to save is 0. This also goes for if different quantities is used twice in the same recipe.

# Ingredient similarity
Be careful about treating two ingredients the same that are not the same. For example, "hvidløg" and "løg" are two different ingredients.

# Formatting
The HTML needs to be compatible with most email clients. All lists and sub-lists must have styling attached that will left-align the text within it.

## Good example
This is a good example, because it contains just HTML, nothing else: <html><body>foo</body></html>

## Bad example
This is a Bad example, because it wraps the HTML in markdown tags: 
```html
<html><body>foo</body></html>
```

parameters.excludeFields: categories, amount_of_people.maengde, amount_of_people.note, image_url, url, description, directions

parameters.subject: Madplanen er nu lagt ind i Bilka To Go
parameters.bodyContent:
=Husk at gå ind i Bilka To Go app'en og gennemfør bestillingen for at have ordren klar til afhentning dagen efter.

Respons fra AI agenten: {{ $json.output.response }}

parameters.query: SELECT * FROM n8n."cooking-recipes" WHERE id IN ({{ $json.mealplan.map(id => `'${id}'`).join(',') }})

parameters.text:
=# Recipes for the week (in JSON)
```json
{{ JSON.stringify($json.data) }}
```

parameters.query: UPDATE n8n."cooking-recipes" SET last_used_in_mealplan = NOW() WHERE id IN ({{ $('Remove markdown').item.json.mealplan.map(id => `'${id}'`).join(',') }})

options.systemPromptTemplate: You are highly intelligent and accurate sentiment analyzer. Analyze the sentiment of the provided text. Categorize it into one of the following: {categories}. Use the provided formatting instructions.

json.prompt: Find a simple and quick recipe for four people.
